item.description:
***Due to a larger than expected turnout, they are changing the meeting location to the Trailside Museum entrance 1904 canton ave. in Milton.***

Let's get out of hibernation and do something different (and fun). We'll join Hike4Life for their season opening hike. Why does Hike4Life recommend hiking? "Hiking is a fun and inexpensive way to improve your health!  Hiking and other outdoor activities, also offer a spiritually and mentally refreshing experience. Studies show that African-Americans are at the greatest risk of being diagnosed with Type 1 & 2 Diabetes, higher cholesterol, and high blood pressure (Hypertension) than any other race and our numbers are on the rise." Read more on their About Us page.

Description of the event their website below:

It’s become tradition for Hike4Life members and friends to kick off a new year’s Hiking season with a memorable hike through the Blue Hills. This will be another year of great hikes, great people and great opportunities. We’ve put together a great group of people to help make this a successful year.

We’re looking forward to adding more friends, family, supporters and volunteers to our Team!

Our first hike of 2013 will be the kick off to another great year. We’re going to meet at location 1203 (Border Path) on your Blue Hills Reservation Map.

You can find it here at: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/blue%20hills%20brochure.pdf

I was tempted to put in GPS coordinates but, I don’t have them.

From there we'll tackle a couple of hills right from the road and continue on the trail upward and around the best the Hills has to offer.

I ask everyone to bring water/food so we can make a day of our first day this year together in the woods. Hopefully the weather will be favorable. I will update the invitation as we get closer to the date. Please invite your friends, let them know about Hike4Life and share with stories and pictures of our previous adventures.
item.how_to_find_us: Ill post where we are when I get there. Other groups will be there too.
item.name: Let's Go for a Hike!
